data.title: Why isn’t Lionel Messi playing for Argentina at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
data.meta_description: He may have led his national team to the World Cup in 2022, but there is no place for the Inter Miami star in Paris.
data.text:
Sixteen national teams are competing in the Men’s Olympic Football Tournament at the Paris 2024 Games. The tournament began on Wednesday, July 24, with the rosters for all participating nations already announced.

As per the regulations, each team is allowed to select up to three players over the age of 23, with the remainder of the squad comprising players born on or after January 1, 2001. Notable players such as Alexandre Lacazette, Julián Álvarez, and Achraf Hakimi will be representing their respective countries. As you’ll see, Lionel Messi did not take his place for Argentina, needing a break after the Copa América success and before he attempts to defend the Leagues Cup with Inter Miami.

Below is the list of all players over the age of 23 who have been selected for the Paris 2024 Games.

Interestingly, one nation has opted not to include any overage players. Let’s take a look at them all...

Loic Bade

Where is Mbappé, Messi, Pulisic and Yamal?

Although there was much speculation about some top table names making an appearance at the Games, especially France’s very own superstar, other considerations over health and club meant this wasn’t to be.
